intro: Elatostema cuspidatum var. ecorniculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including regions of India and China. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom during the summer months. This variant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
